programme.title: UFC Fight Night: Sandhagen vs. Font - Prelims
programme.desc: Cody Durden vs. Jake Hadley, flyweight; Billy Quarantillo vs. Damon Jackson, featherweight; Jeremiah Wells vs. Carlston Harris, welterweight; Kyler Phillips vs. Raoni Barcelos, bantamweight. From Bridgestone Arena in Nashville, Tenn.

programme.title: UFC Fight Night: Sandhagen vs. Font
programme.desc: Diego Lopes vs. Gavin Tucker, featherweight; Dustin Jacoby vs. Kennedy Nzechukwu, light heavyweight; Jessica Andrade vs. Tatiana Suarez, strawweight; Cory Sandhagen vs. Rob Font, catchweight. From Bridgestone Arena in Nashville, Tenn.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: 2023 Pro Football Hall of Fame Enshrinement Ceremony
programme.desc: Coverage of the Hall of Fame Enshrinement Ceremony; the Class of 2023 includes Ronde Barber, Don Coryell, Chuck Howley, Joe Klecko, Darrelle Revis, Ken Riley, Joe Thomas, Zach Thomas, and DeMarcus Ware. From Canton, Ohio.

programme.title: E60
programme.desc: Psychedelics may be the future of mental health treatment in sports. E60 follows a group of former athletes with a range of mental and physical conditions as they take part in a medical retreat involving psilocybin, aka Magic Mushrooms.

programme.title: The Gentleman Boxer: Richard Torrez Jr.
programme.desc: A profile of American Olympic silver medalist Richard Torrez Jr., a multi-faceted boxer and man.

programme.title: Hecho en México: Navarrete vs. Valdez
programme.desc: Emanuel Navarrete defends his WBO junior lightweight title against contender Oscar Valdez. This title fight pits a pair of Mexican boxers with one loss each for the crown. From Glendale, Ariz.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The relationship between coaching masters Bill Belichick and Bill Parcells that spans over four decades.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: In 1982, facing troubled times, America was looking for inspiration. Filmmaker Al Szymanski shows how a group of Little Leaguers from Kirkland, Wash., inspired a nation.

programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. programme.desc: From Parkway Bank Sports Complex in Rosemont, Ill.

programme.title: Baseball Tonight: Sunday Night Countdown
programme.desc: Leading into each of ESPN's Sunday Night Baseball telecasts is this special edition of "Baseball Tonight." Host Karl Ravech teams with analysts and reporters to present fans a detailed preview of the network's exclusive, national game of the week. Highlights of the day's other games, interviews with players and managers, and key storylines from around the league also fill the hourlong show. Mark Teixeira, Eduardo Pérez, Tim Kurkjian and Buster Olney are among the analysts.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Veteran broadcaster Michael Kay joins former slugger Alex Rodriguez to provide commentary on Sunday Night Baseball. Plus, discussion on fantasy baseball, predictive analytics and special guests tied to the game.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: In-depth, comprehensive daily coverage of all aspects of the NBA from expert analysts.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: College Football Live
programme.desc: Want to know up-to-the-minute reports about your favorite college football team? ESPN has it covered with this weekday studio show, a roundtable format that emphasizes discussion and opinions on the sport's biggest stories and newsmakers. The half-hour program features a rotating roster of analysts that includes coaches, former players, and media personalities.

programme.title: Daily Wager
programme.desc: Doug Kezirian joins sports betting experts as well as ESPN analysts and reporters from various sports for discussion centered on analytics and point spreads as well as how the day's sports news affects betting.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: 2023 BullShooter Invitational Shootout
programme.desc: BullShooter is the originator and innovator of soft tip electronic darts, showcasing elite dart players. High stakes are on the line, as the 1st place and 2nd place players will move onto the Elite 32.

programme.title: Slippery Stairs 2023
programme.desc: Unpredictable, controlled chaos as contestants are challenged with unpredictable steps, slippery slime, dodging balls and the challenge of being the first one to the top.

programme.title: Pillow Fight Championship
programme.desc: Twelve professional PFC pillow fights between hardcore MMA fighters, boiling down to two championship fights for a chance at the Ocho Day Championship title belt and two $5,000 cash prizes.

programme.title: Professional Cuesports League (PCL)
programme.desc: A star-studded lineup of Jeanette "The Black Widow" Lee, Jennifer Barretta, Johnny Archer and Fedor Gorst feature in the PCL Premiere. A social pastime finds rebirth as a fast-paced action game.

programme.title: 2023 NWLA Wiffleball All-Stars
programme.desc: The NWLA Tournament All-Star Game features some of the best wiffleball players representing hometown leagues from throughout the country.

programme.title: Major League Table Tennis

programme.title: TurfWars Invitational: Adult Kickball Championship

programme.title: MLB Baseball

programme.title: FIFA Women's World Cup 2023
programme.desc: Japan takes on Norway at Wellington Regional Stadium in the round of last 16 of the 2023 World Cup. The only previous World Cup meeting was in Chicago in the 1999 group stage. Norway won 4-0 including an eighth-minute penalty scored by Hege Riise.

programme.title: Finding Home: Journey to MLB
programme.desc: Follow players as they fight to make their way to the major leagues.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: The Padres (54-56) try to even this series with the Dodgers (63-45). Los Angeles won a fourth straight match and stretched its division lead to three games with a 10-5 double up Aug. 4. James Outman (LAD) went 2-for-3 with a solo home run in the win.

programme.title: FIFA Women's World Cup 2023
programme.desc: Netherlands plays South Africa at Sydney Football Stadium in the round of last 16 of the 2023 World Cup. Netherlands has won all eight matches versus South Africa, by an aggregate score of 22-5. The most recent was 5-1 in The Hague on April 12, 2022.

programme.title: FIFA Women's World Cup 2023
programme.desc: Sweden contests USA at Melbourne Rectangular Stadium in the round of last 16 of the 2023 World Cup. This is the most played fixture in the World Cup. This is the seventh time they have met at the tournament, but the first time in the knockout phase.

programme.desc: England is up against Nigeria at Brisbane Stadium in the round of last 16 of the 2023 World Cup. This is the second World Cup meeting, after a 3-2 victory for the Lionesses in Karlstad in the 1995 group stage (including two goals by Karen Farley).

programme.desc: The last word on the day's action from the FIFA Women's World Cup.
